member.name: P:IntelliFactory.Build.PackageId.Current
member.summary: The current package identifier, by default determined from the name of the root directory. This is used to tag assemblies with `AssemblyProductAttribute`, and determine full `PackageVersion.Full` by scanning NuGet to auto-increment the build/revision numbers.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.Build.PackageId
member.summary: Package identifier parameters.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.Build.PackageVersion.Text
member.summary: The textual representation, `major.minor-suffix`.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.Build.PackageVersion.Suffix
member.summary: The textual suffix for pre-release versions, if any.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.Build.PackageVersion.Policy
member.summary: The policy to choose the third component in the version number. `AlwaysIncrement` is the default. Caution: if you do not have a build server-provided fourth component, then using another option than `AlwaysIncrement` might cause IntelliFactory.Build to overwrite older builds that are based on the same source but are different because of updated dependencies.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.Build.PackageVersion.Minor
member.summary: The minor number.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.Build.PackageVersion.Major
member.summary: The major number.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.Build.PackageVersion.Full
member.summary: The current full version. This is used to tag assemblies and with `AssemblyFileVersionAttribute`, and may also be used to determine the version of constructed NuGet packages. This defaults to `maj.min.bld.rev` where `maj`, `min` are taken from `PackageVersion.Current`, `bld` is determined by auto-incrementing until there is no conflict with global NuGet packages, and `rev` is only set in build server environments by consuling `BuildConfig.BuildNumber`.

member.name: P:IntelliFactory.Build.PackageVersion.Current
member.summary: The current version, defaults to `0.0`. This is used to tag assemblies with `AssemblyVersionAttribute`, where build and revision numbers are set to `0`. This is also by default used to determine `PackageVersion.Full`.

member.name: M:IntelliFactory.Build.PackageVersion.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses from a string.

member.name: M:IntelliFactory.Build.PackageVersion.Create(System.Int32,System.Int32,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.String})
member.summary: Creates a new version.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.Build.PackageVersion
member.summary: Combines a basic version (major, minor numbers) with an optional textual suffix.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.Build.PackageVersionPolicy.GitCommit
member.summary: Only increment the number if the current git commit is different from the one in which that package was built (if known).

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.Build.PackageVersionPolicy.MercurialCommit
member.summary: Only increment the number if the current hg commit is different from the one in which that package was built (if known).

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.Build.PackageVersionPolicy.AlwaysIncrement
member.summary: Always chooses the highest available NuGet package version + 1.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.Build.PackageVersionPolicy
member.summary: The policy to choose the third component in the version number.

member.summary: Checks whether the current revision has changed since building the given a.b.c version. Returns true if this isn't a Mercurial repository, or if the version isn't found.

member.name: M:IntelliFactory.Build.Mercurial.InferTag(System.String)
member.summary: Given a Mercurial checkout (a directory containing a `.hg` subfolder), infers the current Mercurial tag. If the current directory state is not tagged, returns the long hash instead. Returns `None` if `.hg` is not found. This method does not call Mercurial but analyzes the `.hg` folder directly.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.Build.VSTemplates
member.summary: Provides a facility to generate VisualStudio template archive files. These typically have a `.zip` extension and contain `.vstemplate` XML manifests. Quickstart: use the static methods on `Archive` to construct an in-memory `.zip` representation you can then manipulate.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.Build.VsixExtensions
member.summary: Provides a facility to generate VisualStudio extension `.vsix` files using the 2010 VSIX format compatible with VisualStudio 2010 and VisualStudio 2012, see <http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/vstudio/dd393754(v=vs.100).aspx> Quickstart: use the static methods on `VsixFile` to construct an in-memory `.vsix` representation you can then manipulate.

member.name: T:IntelliFactory.Build.VsixPackages
member.summary: Declares common types for VSIX VisualStudio extensions and VSTemplate packages.
